Yes, there are so many hidden gems at The Met, and discovering them can be a fun and rewarding experience. Here are a few lesser-known exhibitions that you should check out:

1. The Tiffany glass collection: overlook the Tiffany glass collection at your own risk. The museum has numerous pieces of stained glasswork by Louis Comfort Tiffany, including lamps, windows, and decorative art.

2. The Arts of Africa, Oceania, and the Americas: a small but fascinating section of the museum that displays the artwork of indigenous people from different parts of the world.

3. Arms and Armor Collection: this collection displays arms and armor from different parts of the world and different time periods. You can see ancient military gear from Japan, India, and Europe.

4. Robert Lehman Collection: This collection is full of obscure pieces of art collected by the Lehman family in the 20th century. The collection is full of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art, Italian Renaissance paintings, and more.

5. Musical Instruments collection: this collection showcases musical instruments from different parts of the world and different time periods. You can see rare instruments such as bagpipes from the country of Georgia, a triple harp from Italy or even a guitar owned by Elvis Presley.

These are just a few of the lesser-known exhibitions at The Met, but be aware that there are many more to discover. Taking time to explore these hidden gems could be the highlight of your visit to the museum!
